author: A_Brickset_user
title: An OK little set.
review: Good for the curved pieces if you need them. They were rather useful for me. It's okay, but could use more stuff to live up to the price, or the price could've had two USD slashed off. Either would make it more reasonable

author: vhtf_hw_lego
title: Summaries For Snap's Cruiser

author: Berrus_Brickus
title: Name: Snap Lockitt, Occupation: RES-Q surf dude/ti-chi teacher-LI2/IXS
review:
Like Skateboarding Peper and Brickster's Trike, not much to it, but does go well with larger sets.  I honestly don't know how Snap made it into actual sets considering he is a minor character in the LEGO Island games.
 

Pros:
*Snap
*Jet Ski, can always use one in a city/beach
*Rare pieces
*Nice color scheme
*Goes well with the Beach tower
 

Cons:
*Bad cones
*Where there was a flaming road on Brickster's box, there is a water way.

author: benhjt
title: xtreme jetski
review:
a simple and easy build, just parts for the jetski base and top and its done, a jetski and a minifig in the box, color scheme match the overall xtreme theme. price wise its reasonable.

 

overall its a nice set to have.
